1.text: Choose a ball of yarn and a pair of knitting needles.

3.text: Hold the needle with the slipknot on it in your right hand.

4.text: Loop the working yarn over the left-hand needle from front to back.

5.text: Insert the right-hand needle into the loop going from front to back.

6.text: Loop the yarn over the end of the right-hand needle and pull it through.

7.text: Repeat the sequence to create more cast on stitches.

8.text: Transfer the needle with the cast on stitches to your left hand.

9.text: Insert the end of the right-hand needle into the first stitch.

10.text: Loop the yarn over the end of the right-hand needle.

11.text: Pull the yarn through the first cast on stitch and let the old stitch slip off.

12.text: Repeat to the end of the row.

13.text: Turn your work around and knit the next row using the same technique.

14.text: Knit the first 2 stitches as you normally would.

15.text: Insert the left-hand needle into the first stitch on the right-hand needle.

16.text: Bring the first stitch up and over the second stitch.

18.text: Lift the new first stitch up and over the stitch you just knit.

19.text: Repeat the sequence to the end of the row to finish binding off.

20.text: Learn how to purl to do many other types of stitches.

22.text: Try a decorative stitch for a more intricate look.
